newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Bakun Hydro-Electric listing approved by SC.
newsitem.headline: Bakun Hydro-Electric listing approved by SC.

text.p: The proposed stock listing of Bakun Hydro-Electric Corp Bhd on the main board of the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange has been approved by the Securities Commission, Ekran Bhd said on Wednesday.
Ekran is the main contractor for the $5.5 billion Bakun hydroelectric dam, which is being built in the jungles of Sarawak state on Borneo island.
The offering will consist of a public issue of 375 million shares and a special issue of 1.125 billion shares split among five shareholder groups, Ekran said in a statement.
Ekran, a 32 percent shareholder, will hold 480 million shares. The Sarawak state government and Sarawak Electricity Supply Corp will jointly hold 420 million shares.

The Employees Provident Fund, Malaysia's national pension fund, will be owner of 75 million shares. Tenaga Nasional Bhd, the national utility, and state investment arm Khazanah Nasional Bhd will each hold 75 million shares.
Ekran said it will list and quote 1.5 billion shares of Bakun Hydro-Electric, the holding company for the dam, on the stock exchange.

The approval of the Securities Commission is subject to certain conditions including the stipulation that 2.97 billion ringgit in proceeds from the public issue and special issue be used to finance the development of the project.
Ekran said that the SC has also approved a proposed rights issue of 257.14 million new Ekran shares at 5.70 ringgit per share on the basis of one new Ekran share for every one existing share.
